## GAD-7 vs SANS

The Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the Scale for Assessment of Negative Symptoms (SANS) are both crucial tools extensively used in the field of psychology. GAD-7 measures the severity of generalized anxiety disorder, while SANS targets the assessment of negative symptoms often associated with schizophrenia. These diverse instruments, however, often pose a challenge to harmonize, especially when examining their correlation or the holistic view of a patientâ€™s psychological health. This is where Harmony comes into the picture, creating an effortless path in the comparison of GAD-7 vs SANS through advanced natural language processing and generative AI models. Harmony plays an instrumental role in simplifying the interrelation between these significant psychological tools. It allows psychologists to obtain a percentage match between each item in both GAD-7 and SANS and other such tools. With Harmony, you can easily drag in these testing tools in PDF format and witness the AI seamlessly unravel their harmonization. While the idea of comparing GAD-7 vs SANS manually can be quite daunting, Harmony ensures precision, saving psychologists notable time and removing the risk of subjective analysis. Engaging with Harmony ensures ease of access, speed, and accuracy in drawing comparisons between GAD-7 and SANS, pivotal in the treatment, research, and general understanding of diverse psychological conditions. By enabling a comprehensive comparison of GAD-7 vs SANS and other such psychological instruments, Harmony significantly enhances the efficiency of studies in psychology. Infused with the capacity to compare items even in multiple languages, Harmony embraces an unparalleled level of advancement in the field of psychological research.

## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
